page.title: 13Braithwell Parish Council
page.content: The first meeting of Braithwell Parish Council was held on the 14th December, 1894. The Parish includes the villages of Braithwell and Micklebring. Untill 1st April, 1974 it came under the jurisdiction of Doncaster Rural District Council, but since has been responsible to Doncaster Metropolitan Borough Council. There are five Parish Councillors and a Clerk. Meetings are normally held on the last Wednesday of each month and must be advertised in a prominent place in the Parish at least three days before a meeting. Minutes of proceedings are kept and signed by the chairman after the Council are satisfied as to their accuracy. Parish funds are obtained in the form of a Parish precept by agreeing a Parish rate. Braithwell Parish Council tries to evoke public interest in Parish & Local Government.
